sense.name: money bet by card players, jackpot
sense.commentary: KITTY[+quantity][+sum][+bets][+jackpot] Note: usually implies one person gets all the benefit - the whole pot
sense.examples: The kitty was over two hundred dollars during our last poker hand. John put a dollar in the kitty to see Bob and then raised him two more. Jane started a kitty at work for betting on when Mary's baby is due.

sense.name: contributions donated by individuals for some purpose
sense.commentary: KITTY[+quantity][+sum][+contributions][+reserve] Note: implies everyone involved may share in the benefit.
sense.examples: Take some money for lunch out of the household kitty in the glass jar. The neighbors are putting a kitty together for a block party this summer.

sense.name: informal usage for a domestic cat, often young
sense.examples: The child called the kitty but it hid under the couch. Here, kitty, kitty, kitty. They just adopted two three-month old kitties.
